text: Christian Neunhauserer (born 21 June 1978) is a retired Italian middle- distance runner. He represented his country at two consecutive World Indoor Championships. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2001 |Universiade |Beijing, China |11th (sf) |800 m |1:48.08 |- |rowspan=2|2002 |European Indoor Championships |Vienna, Austria |11th (sf) |800 m |1:50.82 |- |European Championships |Munich, Germany |21st (h) |800 m |1:48.25 |- |rowspan=2|2003 |World Indoor Championships |Birmingham, United Kingdom |13th (h) |800 m |1:49.54 |- |Universiade |Daegu, South Korea |8th (sf) |800 m |1:49.49 |- |rowspan=2|2005 |Mediterranean Games |Almería, Spain |7th |800 m |1:48.64 |- |Universiade |Izmir, Turkey |11th (sf) |800 m |1:49.08 |- |rowspan=2|2006 |World Indoor Championships |Moscow, Russia |18th (h) |1500 m |3:47.90 |- |European Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |24th (h) |1500 m |3:49.34 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *400 metres – 49.00 (Milan 2003) *800 metres – 1:46.07 (Rome 2002) *1000 metres – 2:21.54 (Rupertwinkel 2001) *1500 metres – 3:40.37 (Villafranca 2007) Indoor *800 metres – 1:47.72 (Stuttgart 2003) *1000 metres – 2:19.45 ( 2002) *1500 metres – 3:42.08 (Vienna 2006) ==References== ==External links== * Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Italian male middle-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2005 Mediterranean Games Category:Athletics competitors of Gruppo Sportivo Forestale
title: Christian Neunhauserer
